Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the severity of the incident by stating that the girl was about to be sexually assaulted, when in fact she was nabbed with bad intentions.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or details to support the assertion that the girl was rescued from being sexually assaulted.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the person caught in the video is the perpetrator and his name is Sajid, without providing any concrete evidence or confirmation.
Contradict fact: The claim initially states that the perpetrator's name is Sajid, but it is later revealed that the actual name of the accused is Gokul Ramdas.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim presents one version of the incident, but there may be alternative explanations or perspectives that are not considered or mentioned.
